cz.ive.trigger
Class MoveGoalTrigger

java.lang.Object
  cz.ive.messaging.SyncHook
      cz.ive.trigger.MoveGoalTrigger
All Implemented Interfaces:
Hook, Listener, OntologyToken, Trigger, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
HuntGoalTrigger
public class MoveGoalTrigger
extends SyncHook
implements Trigger, Listener, java.io.Serializable

This is a MoveGoalTrigger. It expects sources 'actor' and 'targetPosition' to be ent and waypoint phantoms.
The trigger finds a path and changes the sources as the actor is moving. If it cannot do a step because the step target is occupied, at first it tries to wait for a random time if it won't get empty. If it is still occupied, it tries to sidestep - performs a step somewhere to let the occupier move away. Then it wait whether the companion will step to the released WayPoint. If it does, it's pushing us and we make another sidestep. We try to find a new way all the time.
Waiting for something is a little tricky. The actor makes steps on it's WayPoint, not moving, steping in the place. These steps take a ten times shorter time then regular steps, which enables them to differentiate the waiting times and to react fastly on changes.
Another trick is, that each WayPoint can say, if it is occupied or not, and moreover, if the occupier is going away or if some occupier is going in. This allows trigger to prevent failing steps when two ents are stepping on the same WayPoint.

Author:
honza
See Also:

getFirstNeighbourParent

public static WayPoint getFirstNeighbourParent(WayPoint origin,
                                               IveId target)
Gets first parent of the given WayPoint, that is neighbour of the second given WayPoint (possibly a phantom)

Parameters:
origin - WayPoint from which to start the search upwards.
target - WayPoint (possibly a phantom) which might by a neighbour.
Returns:
the first parent that is neighbour of the target WayPoint or null if no such exists. The returned WayPoint may be even the given origin WayPoint.
